## Misc {#sec-job-search-misc .unnumbered}

-   Resources
    -   [Gitlab's The Remote Playbook](https://handbook.gitlab.com/handbook/company/culture/all-remote/)
-   Job board sites like [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/), [ZipRecruiter](https://www.ziprecruiter.com/), and [Indeed](https://www.indeed.com/)
-   Company career pages
-   Recruiters
-   [Unemployment Benefits Finder](https://www.careeronestop.org/LocalHelp/UnemploymentBenefits/find-unemployment-benefits.aspx) - To look up your state's policy
-   [Plan Finder](https://finder.healthcare.gov/) - state-sponsored health insurance plans
-   Standard of Living [Calculator](https://www.nerdwallet.com/cost-of-living-calculator) for various cities
-   [Caveats Before Signing a Non-Compete](https://www.investopedia.com/articles/personal-finance/070114/caution-noncompete-contract.asp)
    -   Sometimes severance is associated with the noncompete to ensure that enough time has passed before laid-off employees start a new job, so as to make any information they have obsolete.
    -   If you don't have a noncompete, apply for jobs at your former company's competitor. If you do have a noncompete, flag some companies' career pages for later.
